properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK - BOLIVIA New England Highway at Bolivia Hill (32km south of Tenterfield)
properties.otherAdvice:
A 2.6km section of the highway at Bolivia Hill has been reduced to one lane to allow for road widening work.

Portable traffic lights are in place at the top and bottom of Bolivia Hill to ensure safe passage through and allow motorists to pass in one direction at a time. Delays up to 10 minutes can be expected.

There is also a three metre width restriction for oversize &/or overmass (OSOM) vehicles. Loads in excess of three metres wide need to contact the OSOM Road Access Unit on 1300 656 371.

properties.headline: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance - WISEMANS FERRY Webbs Creek Ferry between River Road AND St Albans Road
properties.otherAdvice: The ferry will be out of service on the first Tuesday of each month from 9:30am until midday.
properties.displayName: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance

properties.headline: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance - ULMARRA Ulmarra Ferry between Pacific Highway AND Wharf Rd
properties.otherAdvice: Ferry services generally do not operate on the first Wednesday of each month between 9:30am and 11:30am. This month the closure has been extended until 1:30pm to carry out the installation of new drive cables.
properties.diversions: Use Lawrence Ferry or Grafton Bridge.
properties.displayName: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance

properties.headline: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance - BEROWRA WATERS Berowra Waters Ferry between Bay Road AND Berowra Waters Road
properties.otherAdvice: Ferry services will not operate on the second Tuesday of each month between midday and 2:30pm.
properties.diversions: Boundary Rd, New Line Rd, Galston Rd, Arcadia Rd and Bay Rd.
properties.displayName: FERRY OUT OF SERVICE Routine maintenance

webLinks.linkText: M1 Pacific Motorway upgrade - Tuggerah to Doyalson

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Upgrade - TUGGERAH TO DOYALSON M1 Pacific Motorway between Wyong Road AND Motorway Link Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Drivers of oversize and/or overmass (OSOM) are required to contact the project hotline on 1800 841 778 prior to travel.

1 of 2 right turn lanes will be closed on the M1 Pacific Mwy northbound off-ramp to Sparks Rd until approximately January 2020. Sparks Rd eastbound above the M1 Pacific Mwy is also reduced to one lane during this time.

Motorists are advised to follow traffic controls in place.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK M1 Pacific Motorway upgrade - KARIONG TO SOMERSBY M1 Pacific Motorway (F3) between Central Coast Highway AND Peats Ridge Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Reduced lane, shoulder and median shoulder widths and a reduced speed limit of 80km/h will be in place 24hrs a day.

Lane closures will occur during work hours and traffic controls will be in place to allow motorists to pass the work site.
properties.displayName: SCHEDULED ROADWORK M1 Pacific Motorway upgrade

properties.headline: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS - LISAROW Pacific Highway at Railway Crescent
properties.otherAdvice:
There is a reduction in length of the right turn lane from Pacific Hwy into Railway Cr and the right turn lane out of Railway Cr onto the highway.

There will also be a minor realignment of Pacific Hwy south of Ourimbah St near Lisarow Cemetery, and the bus stop on Railway Cr will be moved 20 metres to the north.

properties.otherAdvice: The M4 Mwy in both directions will also be simultaneously closed between 11pm-4am.

properties.otherAdvice: Lanes 1 and 2 (of 4 northbound lanes) will be closed throughout the work, with a third lane to close Sunday morning from 12:01 to 7am.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Major improvements - BOGGABILLA (NORTH OF MOREE) Newell Highway between Lowes Rd AND Mungle Back Creek
properties.otherAdvice:
Lane width reduced to 3.2m - all oversize or overmass (OSOM) vehicles to contact the project team on 1800 741 636 before commencing your trip and contact traffic control on approach to site, using UHF 28 for northbound and UHF 27 for southbound, to minimise delays.

Lane closures are expected during work hours and traffic controls will be in place.  Motorists are advised to allow around 10 minutes extra travel time.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK - BERRY TO BOMADERRY Princes Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
The speed limit between Mullers Lane, Berry, and Cambewarra Rd, Bomaderry, has been reduced to 80km/h and a reduced speed limit of 40km/h may apply during roadwork.

There will be temporary stopping of highway traffic for up to two minutes as required while work is progressing.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK - JERRYS PLAINS Golden Highway at Ogilvies Hill and Winery Hill
properties.adviceB: Exercise caution; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
Upgrades will be made to a two-kilometre section of highway near Ogilvies Hill and a four-kilometre section between Bowmans Crossing and Saddlers Creek at Winery Hill, providing overtaking opportunities in both directions as well as five-metre clear zones and greater freight access.

Oversize and/or overmass (OSOM) vehicles greater than 4.5m wide are required to stop at the designated stopping bays located on either side of each worksite and follow the signage prior to travelling through the work zone.

In addition, vehicles greater than 4.6m wide may not be physically able to travel through the work zone without assistance and must contact 0447 696 628 at least five days before travel.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Upgrade - WHITTINGHAM Golden Highway near Range Road (6km south of Singleton)
properties.otherAdvice:
Motorists are advised to allow 10 minutes extra travel time.

Motorists are also advised that work on new overtaking lanes at Ogilvies Hill and Winery Hill will add up to an additional 15 minutes to journeys on the Golden Highway. 

Oversized loads wider than 4m should contact the site office at least 2 days prior to moving the load on 4968 5225.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Road/lane widening - LISAROW Dora Street at Railway Crescent, Niagara Park
properties.otherAdvice: Dora St will be closed at Railway Cr for around 2 years, as part of the Pacific Hwy duplication project.
properties.diversions: Road users wishing to access Railway Cr will detour via Dora St, Cambourn Dr and Excelsior St.

properties.headline: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS Showground Road upgrade - CASTLE HILL Showground Road between Kentwell Avenue AND Pennant Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Work will take place up to five nights a week and alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions may be implemented as required.

Showground Road upgrade stage 1 will run for around nine months and will involve:

  • long term speed reduction to 40km/h on Showground Rd between Kentwell Av and Pennant St;
  • closure of Kentwell Av (indefinitely) and Cheriton Av access to Showground Rd;
  • barrier placement and one lane in each direction on Showground Rd between Kentwell Av and Pennant St.
properties.displayName: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS Showground Road upgrade

properties.adviceB: Check signage; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
Work on the western roundabout will be carried out on Saturday night,  1 February 2020. During this time, access to the Pacific Highway at the Bald Hill Road interchange will be closed to traffic from the western roundabout (Giinagay Way) and Bald Hill Road will be open to local traffic only.

Motorists are advised to expect delays of around five minutes.
properties.diversions:
Motorists travelling north on Giinagay Way will detour to the north of Macksville to join the Pacific Highway at Old Coast Road.

Motorists travelling south from Macksville on Giinagay Way will be able to join the Pacific Highway at Upper Warrell Creek.

Light vehicles and buses
Westbound: Flint St, Oxford St, Newell Hwy, to Camp St.
Eastbound: Newell Hwy, Oxford St, Flint St, to Bridge St.

Heavy vehicles (over 22.5T or 12.5m long)
Westbound: Flint St, Reymond St, Lachlan Valley Way, Wongajong Rd, Red Bend Rd, Wirrinya Rd, and Newell Hwy back to Forbes.
Eastbound is the same in reverse. This will add around 20 minutes to your travel time.
Note: This diversion has a 68T weight and 5.2m width restriction over Iron Bridge on Reymond St.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Bridge work - WENTWORTH TO BROKEN HILL Silver City Highway on Bunnerungee Bridge over Great Darling Anabranch (approximately 65km north of Wentworth)
properties.otherAdvice:
Light and heavy vehicles can now access the Bunnerungee Bridge, 65 kilometres north of Wentworth on the Silver City Highway.  
Motorists are able to access one lane of the bridge under the control of portable traffic lights.

There are no load restrictions on the bridge, and a reduced speed limit of 40 km/h is in place for the safety of workers and motorists. The 3.5-metre wide side track running parallel to Bunnerungee Bridge has been closed.   Motorists are advised to drive to the conditions, and follow the directions of signs and traffic control.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK - GIBRALTAR RANGE Gwydir Highway between Jackadgery AND Glen Elgin
properties.adviceB: Exercise caution; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
Work is taking place across multiple sites between Ramornie and Glen Elgin to repair safety barriers, pavement and drainage, clean up damaged trees and improve slope stability to help prevent rock falls and road slippage.  

Motorists are advised there could be delays of up to 10 minutes at each work site between 7am and 6pm weekdays and that a 60km/h speed limit applies to about a 15 kilometre section of road on the Gibraltar Range.

Motorists should allow up to 45 minutes extra travel time between Grafton and Glen Innes.

Oversize and overmass loads in excess of three metres will be allowed to travel on weekends. Enquiries should be directed to the Road Access Unit on 1300 656 371 between 9am and 5pm weekdays.

Expected to remain this way until at least March 2020.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK - MOUNT SEAVIEW Oxley Highway at Mt Seaview Road
properties.otherAdvice:
The whole of the Oxley Highway between Wauchope and Walcha is open to two way traffic.   

Damaged trees have been removed and guardrail has been repaired over a 50 kilometre section, but a 60 km/h speed restriction remains in place as clean-up operations continue.  

Work to repair pavement damaged by falling trees, to reinstate signage and guideposts, and remove waste materials and debris from the side of the road is continuing.

Work is in progress on the Oxley Highway between Ralfes Creek and Kangaroo Flat (a distance of 60km) from 6am to 6pm on weekdays until the end of March.

This work will continue to impact road users with delays of up to five minutes per site.

Motorists are advised to allow up to an extra 25 minutes travel time through the impacted section of road.

Motorists are advised  delays of up to 10 minutes are possible at each work site between 7am and 6pm on weekdays, with a 60km/h speed limit in place for a 15 kilometre section of road on the Gibraltar Range. Motorists should allow up to 45 minutes extra travel time between Grafton and Glen Innes.

properties.headline: SCHEDULED ROADWORK Intersection upgrade - BLACKTOWN Reservoir Rd at Great Western Hwy
properties.adviceB: Check signage; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
Motorists on Reservoir Rd will be detoured.

Through-traffic on Great Western Hwy can continue through the intersection, however motorists wishing to turn north or south onto Reservoir Rd will be detoured.
properties.diversions:
Light Vehicle Detour 
- Eastbound on Great Western Hwy can turn left onto Reservoir Rd Northbound. Motorists wanting to turn right will continue along Great Western Hwy and Prospect Hwy.        
- Westbound on Great Western Hwy can turn left onto Reservoir Rd Southbound. Motorists wanting to turn right will continue along Great Western Hwy, Doonside Rd and Holbeche Rd
- Southbound on Reservoir Rd will use Holbeche Rd, Doonside Rd and Great Western Hwy
- Northbound on Reservoir Rd will use Great Western Hwy, Doonside Rd, Holbeche Rd
- Northbound on Reservoir Rd wanting to turn right onto Great Western Hwy will use Great Western Hwy, Doonside Rd, Holbeche Rd, Walters Rd 

Heavy Vehicle Detour:
- Eastbound on Great Western Hwy can turn left onto Reservoir Rd northbound. Motorists wanting to turn right will continue along Great Western Hwy and Prospect Hwy
- Westbound on Great Western Hwy can turn left onto Reservoir Rd southbound. Motorists wanting to turn right will use Prospect Hwy, Blacktown Rd and Bungarribee Rd or alternatively turn left onto Reservoir Rd southbound, M4 Motorway eastbound and Prospect Hwy, Blacktown Rd, Bungarribee Rd   
southbound on Reservoir Rd will use Bungarribee Rd, Blacktown Rd, Prospect Hwy 
- East and Westbound on M4 Mtwy will exit at Prospect Hwy or alternatively Reservoir Rd and Prospect Hwy
